page.title: 11Well Through The Ages
page.content: There was a settlement from pagan times and the Romans built a villa here.That was discovered during pipe laying in 1859 and more was exposed while trench digging from Holly Hill in 1876.The site was badly disturbed but a scientific excavation in 1929 revealed part of a tessellated pavement which is now in the church. The Saxon Thane Torchil had a manor which went to Count Alan in 1086,when Bernulf was tenant.It was held by the lords of Middleham & in 1577 went to the Cecil family then after some 60 years with the Milbanks was bought by the family of the present owner. The size of the village has not altered very much although old properties have been replaced by drier and more comfortable homes.Only one shop is left out of several, no smithy and no mill.
